isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - 5 SPEED TRANSMISSIONS SPICER ES43-5 AND ES53-5 - REASSEMBLY - MAINSHAFT

step1.para: Begin reassembly by placing the mainshaft in an upright position ( Figure 50). Also at this time, coat all bearings (inside diameters and outside diameters) with Moly #2 grease. This will help protect them the first time the unit is placed back in service.

figure.caption: Figure 50. Place Mainshaft in Upright Position

step1.para: Assemble the lubricated caged needle bearing, 1st speed gear (clutching teeth down), lock pin and lubricated thrust washer ( Figure 51). Secure them with a snap ring with the flat side against the washer. Remember to wear safety glasses.

figure.caption: Figure 51. Assemble Lubricated Caged Needle Bearing, 1st Speed Gear, Lock Pin, Lubricated Thrust Washer

step1.para: Place the lubricated caged needle bearing and 2nd speed gear onto the shaft ( Figure 52). The clutching teeth should face up.

figure.caption: Figure 52. Place 2nd Speed Gear onto Shaft

step1.para: Lubricate both sides of the reversible 2nd-3rd speed clutch gear, then install it ( Figure 53). Secure it with a snap ring. The flat side of the snap ring should face the gear.

figure.caption: Figure 53. Install Reversible 2nd-3rd Speed Clutch Gear

step1.para: Place oil on the synchronizer outer diameters, then install the synchronizer. The longest synchronizer side should face 2nd gear when the synchronizer is in neutral ( Figure 54).

Install the caged needle bearing, 3rd speed gear (clutching teeth down), lock pin, and lubricated thrust washer ( Figure 55). Secure them with the snap ring. The flat side of the snap ring goes against the thrust washer.
Next install the lubricated caged needle bearing and 4th speed gear (clutching teeth up) ( Figure 56).
Lubricate the mating face of the 4th-5th speed clutch gear, then slide it onto the mainshaft ( Figure 57). Secure it with a spiral snap ring.

figure.caption: Figure 57. Slide 4th-5th Speed Clutch Gear onto Mainshaft

step1.para: Prepare to install the pocket bearing ( Figure 58). One side has a small, chamfered inner diameter.

figure.caption: Figure 58. Pocket Bearing Has Chamfered Inner Diameter

step1.para: The other side has a larger "rolled" area ( Figure 59).
Use a suitable driver to install the pocket bearing with the chamfered inner diameter up ( Figure 60). Then pack the bearing with Moly #2 grease. This completes mainshaft reassembly.
